text:
Hi,

When i try to record a web application, which works correctly in normal navigation using any browser. but when i try to record it through jmeter and proxy set on firefox/opera, the application comes up weird, the page only half loads with a warning log - 


2014/01/09 02:04:13 WARN  - jmeter.protocol.http.proxy.HttpRequestHdr: Url 'https://xxx.abc.com:443/client/xx.get?ABC.Views.Show&PLANTVIEW-REPORT-RENDER&REP_REPORT=$reports\\recent-plants.xml&REP_STORE=ABC&CALL_TEMPLATE=$' contains unsafe characters, will escape it, message:Illegal character in query at index 122: https://xxx.abc.com:443/client/xx.get?ABC.Views.Show&PLANTVIEWS-REPORT-RENDER&REP_REPORT=$reports\\recent-plants.xml&REP_STORE=CLIENT&EXECUTE_TEMPLATE=$ 

Could some one please look into this issue and provide a reliable solution.

Note: in case of header request defaults added to test plan , i have defined HTTP Request to be UTF-8 before start of recording

Many thanks,
Revanth

text:
According to JMeter 2.11 log , the warn message only notifies that URL will be escaped and according to log it succeeds.
So your issue does not seem to be related to a bug.

Could you check you have setup correctly jmeter for recording :
- https://wiki.apache.org/jmeter/TestRecording210
- http://jmeter.apache.org/usermanual/component_reference.html#HTTP%28S%29_Test_Script_Recorder
- Ensure you accept jmeter certificate before starting recording

Can you switch to jmeter user mailing list ?
